title: Truist website issue
content:
I have both personal and business account with Truist bank. Until recently, I never had problems accessing both accounts. The login URL is https://dias.bank.truist.com

Weeks ago, I started to have problem with the business account using Firefox 117.0 64-bit Windows 10. I can still login. But the page is stuck in loading. Strange thing is, my personal account works just fine.

My business account works fine in Microsoft Edge and the Truist phone app.

I tried Firefox troubleshooting mode. Results are the same. I don't have any add-on installed. I played around different privacy and security settings, but couldn't resolve the problem.

Anybody can help? Thanks.
creator: inclusion

title: Search engine fail
content:
Using Firefox today I tried to search for various things using https://oceanhero.today/search.. I got this error message:

"Sorry, there was an error when rendering your search. We were notified and will try to resolve this issue as soon as possible."

But the search engine - which I've been using on Firefox for a long time without any problems - works fine on Bing.

Is there a remedy? Many thanks for any advice.

title: Bookmark empty folders problem
content:
I have a PC desktop and laptop. Bookmarks have always been synced in the past. I have just been away for 6 weeks and added and changed many bookmarks on the laptop. I confess I do have a lot built up over the years. When I came back home I expected to sync as in the past without problem to the desktop. However sync wouldn't happen although both were ON and on same wi-fi. So I restored into the desktop a json file I had made on the laptop just before coming home. I also have a json file made on the desktop just before leaving.

Disaster. While all the bookmarks may be there on the desktop (I don't know) all the folders are now empty and all bookmarks are simply in one huge unusable list in the bookmarks menu. Same result with the desktop json file. It would take days to put them all back into folders one by one. Having tried various things now my laptop is the same !

Why did this happen ? How do I get the bookmarks back into all the folders ?
creator: awljones9

title: Firefox Browser vanishes "off screen"!
content: Firefox browser windows seem to be invisible despite still running. I HAVE TO CHANGE WINDOWS 7 Screen resolution to minimum and the windows reappear; THEN then I can change back to maximum resolution and all is well - UNTIL THE NEXT TIME. IT APPEARS TO ME that the screen offset coordinates are somehow becoming corrupted. How to fix please? Windows Build 7601 SP 1 - if that helps.

title: Connection to server now fails: SEC_ERROR_INADEQUATE_KEY_USAGE
content:
I access a CCTV Network Video Recorder on the same private/LAN that I'm on using an PC via HTTPS. It's been working fine for nearly a year. Recently it won't access via HTTPS any more with the Error Message "Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to 192.168.1.30. Certificate key usage inadequate for attempted operation. Error code: SEC_ERROR_INADEQUATE_KEY_USAGE 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the web site owners to inform them of this problem."

I've contacted the vendor but they seem at a bit of a loss. I can connect using HTTP, and an Android App (spit) still works too. I did find a Stack Overflow article from 2020 mentioning a possible corrupt cert9.db and/or cert_override.txt files, but as it's so old I wanted to ask for further advice before I start hacking things around. On another PC using the same browser version on the same network I get the attached response, not the same as the one I get and it will allow me to accept the risk. Can anyone help please?
creator: andy24

title: Cookies in new FF-installation from sites I have not visited, but which are part of my imported bookmarks
content:
Hi,

to get rid of old remains in my very firefox portable installation, I decided to install FF from scratch. After the installation, I installed some add-ons + imported settings for umatrix and ublock origin + imported my backuped bookmarks. Now, I was checking the cookies settings, because I want to have most of them deleted after closing ff. I realized, that there are cookies from sites, which I didn't visit since the new installation. And no, I don't think that these are third party cookies, which were set during the visit of other sites, because those sites are for sure don't interact with other sites for merchandising reasons etc. The sites are also not to be found in the "History". I just installed FF three days ago. I'll deactivate the "history", too.

Does anybody has a clue how it come, that I have such cookies in my list?

Many thanks

title: Firefox Auto-updater kills Firefox on work mac
content:
I was experiencing this issue on my intel mac, but I've just upgraded and it also appears to be an issue on the replacement with an m2 chip.

I'll be using Firefox, when all of a sudden it locks up. Usually I think this could be an internet connectivity issue, but checking in a second browser shows I have connectivity. The next thing I try is to re-launch Firefox, where I am told that Finder cannot launch Firefox. Looking at the .app file in applications reveals the file is now 0 bytes large. I then download a fresh copy of Firefox and I'm back in business. I've noted this is appears to occur right after a patch is released.

I can't say I've noticed the same issue on my personal mac, although I tend to turn that off more regularly.

title: Sites (youtube) Crashing often
content: Hi, Various Sites (sometimes firefox as a whole) keep crashing regularly. I am running Arch Linux (6.4.12, default kernel) with Hyprland WM on an old i7-7700K with a Nvidia GTX980TI. Apart from Firefox the system runs stable. When doing research, or just browsing text based sites, firefox is also very stable, but on some sites like twitch, youtube, or idle games like "Antimatter Dimensions" (ivark.github.io) the browser (or page) crashes regularly. It also happens in Troubleshoot mode, also after a clean re-install (including deleting /.mozilla in /home) and since various versions over the last couple of month. The latest crash report ID is bp-67ed2673-4ed2-452b-bc63-dc1060230831. I know I'm running a niche system, but I really like my setup and apart from those crashes it's amazing, so I hope you can help and point me in the right direction as to what could cause the crashes. Thanks for your time. KR, rehajel

title: Unable to whitelist websites in the settings menu
content:
As a Firefox user, I want to be able to whitelist websites as they continue to be impermissible to people using their website without having to give up all privacy, such that their website works.

Replication Steps: 1. Open Firefox Browser 2. Go to top left and click hamburger icon (3 horizontal lines) in top right under the close option 3. Click Settings 4. On left side click privacy and security 5. Locate permissions in the submenu 6. Location -> Settings 7. Add website into search bar and hit enter to add to whitelist

Current Result: Cannot add to whitelist and cannot utilize website with browser. Will be forced to use competitions browser.

Expected Result: Site would be added to whitelist and therefore allow use of a site that is arbitrarily adding forced location permissions because vpns are well... hurting their bottom line to be frank.
